get.summary:
ListCollections returns all collections for the authenticated user
Required Permissions:
- write:serverless

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

delete.summary:
DeleteCollection removes a collection by ID
Required Permissions:
- write:serverless

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: ID of the collection to delete

put.summary:
Upgrade collection: If current user have paid account, this API will lift the limit of the collection
Required Permissions:
- write:serverless

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the account (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

parameters.name: collectionId
parameters.description: ID of the collection to upgrade

post.summary:
CreateCollection creates a new collection with the specified configuration
Required Permissions:
- write:serverless

parameters.name: collection.accountId
parameters.description:
Identifier of the account associated with the collection (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

id.description:
Unique identifier for the collection (in Guid format).
This is a read-only field and will be available after a collection is created.

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the collection was created.
This is a read-only field and will be available after a collection is created.

name.title:
Name of the collection.
This is a required field.
Name can only contain letters, numbers, underscores and dashes

deletedAt.description:
Timestamp when the collection was deleted (or is started to be deleting).
This is a read-only field and will be set after DeleteCollection is called.

cloudProvider.title:
Cloud provider where the collection is hosted.
This is a optional field (one of the following: aws, gcp, azure).
After creation, this field cannot be changed.
If not specified - use default provider

cloudRegion.title:
In which region the collection is hosted
After creation, this field cannot be changed.
Example: us-west1
If not specified - use default region for the selected provider (or default provider if not specified)

collection.title: Collection represents a vector search collection in the Qdrant serverless environment

CollectionServiceCreateCollectionBody.title: CreateCollectionRequest defines parameters for creating a new collection

CollectionServiceUpgradeCollectionBody.title: Upgrade limits of the specified collection

url.title: URL to access the qdrant collection (aka serverless database) without port

restPort.title: The port to use for HTTP REST calls (6333)

grpcPort.title: The port to use for gRPC calls (6334)

collectionv1ClusterEndpoint.description:
Endpoint information to access the qdrant collection (aka serverless database).
All fields in this message are a read-only field.

onDisk.title: Whether to store index on disk vs memory

v1BoolIndexParams.title: BoolIndexParams defines parameters for boolean indexing

id.description:
Unique identifier for the collection (in Guid format).
This is a read-only field and will be available after a collection is created.

createdAt.description:
Timestamp when the collection was created.
This is a read-only field and will be available after a collection is created.

accountId.description:
Identifier of the account associated with the collection (in Guid format).
This is a required field.

name.title:
Name of the collection.
This is a required field.
Name can only contain letters, numbers, underscores and dashes

deletedAt.description:
Timestamp when the collection was deleted (or is started to be deleting).
This is a read-only field and will be set after DeleteCollection is called.

cloudProvider.title:
Cloud provider where the collection is hosted.
This is a optional field (one of the following: aws, gcp, azure).
After creation, this field cannot be changed.
If not specified - use default provider

cloudRegion.title:
In which region the collection is hosted
After creation, this field cannot be changed.
Example: us-west1

v1Collection.title: Collection represents a vector search collection in the Qdrant serverless environment

tenantKey.title: Field name used for tenant isolation

denseVectors.title: Map of dense vector configurations with field name as key

sparseVectors.title: Map of sparse vector configurations with field name as key

v1CollectionConfiguration.title: CollectionConfiguration defines the structure and settings for a collection

phase.title:
The current operational status of the collection.
- ready: Collection is fully operational and available for use
- processing: Collection is being created, updated, or undergoing maintenance
- disabled: Collection has been temporarily or permanently disabled

reason.description:
Descriptive message explaining any errors or issues with the collection.
Empty when the collection is operating normally.

endpoint.description:
The URL endpoint where clients can connect to and interact with the collection.
Not set if the collection is not yet ready or is disabled.

v1CollectionState.description:
CollectionState represents the operational state of a collection in the Qdrant serverless environment.
It provides status information, error details (if any), and endpoint access information.

collection.title: Collection represents a vector search collection in the Qdrant serverless environment

v1CreateCollectionResponse.title: CollectionResponse provides details about a created collection

isPrincipal.title: Whether this is a principal field

onDisk.title: Whether to store index on disk vs memory

v1DatetimeIndexParams.title: DatetimeIndexParams defines parameters for datetime indexing

v1DeleteCollectionResponse.title: DeleteCollectionResponse is an empty response for deletion confirmation

dimension.title: The dimensionality of the vector space

distance.title: The distance metric used for vector similarity calculations

multivector.title: Whether to use multi-vector storage for this configuration

rescoring.title: Whether to enable rescoring for search results

storageTier.title: The storage performance tier to use (STORAGE, BALANCED, or PERFORMANCE)

precisionTier.title: The precision level for vector operations (LOW, MEDIUM, or HIGH)

collections.title: List of collections with their details

v1PayloadFieldSchema.title: Describes the schema for a payload field
